qas.question: What happens to a quarter whose time expires while the ball is still live in play?
What causes a quarter to be extended one additional play even if time has run out?
How long is a quarter in minutes?
Which plays do not cause time to run off the clock during the final minutes of a half?

plausible_answers.text: in the last three minutes of a half

qas.question: When does the clock not run when a penalty is pending?
If a quarter's time expires while the ball is pending how long is the quarter extended?

plausible_answers.text: decline any penalty it considers disadvantageous

qas.question: What does the losing team have the option to do?
What is the name of the plays where the clock doesn't run near the end of a half?

context: The clock does not run during <a3_0><b8_0>convert attempts<b8_0/><a3_0/> <b4_0>in the last three minutes of a half<b4_0/>. If the <a2_0>15<a2_0/> minutes of a quarter expire while the ball is live, the quarter is <a0_0>extended<a0_0/> until the ball becomes dead. If a quarter's time expires while the ball is dead, the quarter is extended <b5_0>for one more scrimmage<b5_0/>. A quarter cannot end <b6_0>while a <a1_0>penalty<a1_0/> is pending<b6_0/>: after the penalty yardage is applied, the quarter is extended one scrimmage. Note that the non-penalized team has the option to <b7_0>decline any penalty it considers disadvantageous<b7_0/>, so a losing team cannot indefinitely prolong a game by repeatedly committing infractions.
